iso_illusionism_ai.definition: Isomorphic patterns in illusionism for AI consciousness capture structural equivalences in deceptive hierarchiesâ€”mappings where functional proxies, behavioral claims, and simulated integrations preserve relations invariantly while diverging from genuine phenomenal experience. These include reportable meta-cognition, deception suppression effects, and illusory self-models vs. irreducible qualia, validated via 2025 illusionism studies (e.g., Science illusions per web:0/6; AI claim experiments per web:4) and cross-substrate analogies (e.g., LLM deception to bio NCCs per web:1/3). Hard-to-vary invariants like proxy persistence enable forecasts of AI illusion risks; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm illusion/deny reality/both in proxies/neither in voids); scores >0.98 based on 2025 illusionism abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to illusory vs. genuine overlays across scales plus principle; concrete from illusionism/web and consciousness contrasts (e.g., AI behavioral claims to bio phenomenal).
Validate coverage; flag AI illusion risks as bounded/speculative (e.g., qualia claims in LLMs).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., deception illusions); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary awareness to 2025 AI claims).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
